1. DynamicLatex.jl
DynamicLatex.jl

On this page

  • Generating tex commands and tables of symbols
  • Quarto extension

Example

Generating tex commands and tables of symbols

using DynamicLatex
using Markdown
 
objects = []
mu, sigma = raw"\mu", raw"\sigma"
@objects objects [
    R bb"R" "real numbers"
    dim "n" "dimension"
    Rn R^dim "vector space over the $R of $dim n"
    parameters raw"\theta" "vector of parameters" (domain=Rn,)
    normal raw"\mathrm{Normal}(#1,#2^2)" raw"normal distribution with mean $#1$ and standard deviation $#2$" (display_args=(mu, sigma), )
]  

write_texdefs("_symbols.tex", objects)
Markdown.parse("""\```
$(DynamicLatex.texdefs(objects))
\```""")
\newcommand{\R}{\mathbb{R}}
\newcommand{\dR}{real numbers}
\newcommand{\iR}{real numbers $\mathbb{R}$}
\newcommand{\ER}{real numbers $\mathbb{R}$}
\newcommand{\Ris}{$\mathbb{R}$ is the real numbers}
\newcommand{\dim}{n}
\newcommand{\ddim}{dimension}
\newcommand{\idim}{dimension $n$}
\newcommand{\Edim}{dimension $n$}
\newcommand{\dimis}{$n$ is the dimension}
\newcommand{\Rn}{{\R}^{\dim}}
\newcommand{\dRn}{vector space over the real numbers of dimension n}
\newcommand{\iRn}{vector space over the real numbers of dimension n ${\R}^{\dim}$}
\newcommand{\ERn}{vector space over the real numbers of dimension n ${\R}^{\dim}$}
\newcommand{\Rnis}{${\R}^{\dim}$ is the vector space over the real numbers of dimension n}
\newcommand{\parameters}{\theta}
\newcommand{\dparameters}{vector of parameters}
\newcommand{\iparameters}{vector of parameters $\theta$}
\newcommand{\Eparameters}{vector of parameters $\theta\in\Rn$}
\newcommand{\parametersis}{$\theta$ is the vector of parameters}
\newcommand{\normal}[2]{\mathrm{Normal}(#1,#2^2)}
\newcommand{\dnormal}[2]{normal distribution with mean $#1$ and standard deviation $#2$}

write_symbols_table("_symbols.md", objects);
Markdown.parse("""\```
$(DynamicLatex.symbols_table(objects))
\```""")  
symbol|meaning|latex
-|---|-
$\mathbb{R}$|real numbers|`\R`
$n$|dimension|`\dim`
${\R}^{\dim}$|vector space over the real numbers of dimension n|`\Rn`
$\theta\in\Rn$|vector of parameters|`\parameters`
$\normal{\mu}{\sigma}$|\dnormal{\mu}{\sigma}|`\normal{\mu}{\sigma}`
symbol meaning latex
\(\mathbb{R}\) real numbers \R
\(n\) dimension \dim
\({\mathbb{R}}^{n}\) vector space over the real numbers of dimension n \Rn
\(\theta\in{\mathbb{R}}^{n}\) vector of parameters \parameters
\(\mathrm{Normal}(\mu,\sigma^2)\) normal distribution with mean \(\mu\) and standard deviation \(\sigma\) \normal{\mu}{\sigma}

Quarto extension

At some point in the HTML rendering process, latex commands which are not in a math environment will be stripped out, such that one gets the below output.

Input Intended output Output without quarto extension
Consider $\Rn$, a \dRn. Consider \({\mathbb{R}}^{n}\), a vector space over the real numbers of dimension n . Consider \({\mathbb{R}}^{n}\), a .
Source Code

# Generating tex commands and tables of symbols

```{julia}
using DynamicLatex
using Markdown
 
objects = []
mu, sigma = raw"\mu", raw"\sigma"
@objects objects [
    R bb"R" "real numbers"
    dim "n" "dimension"
    Rn R^dim "vector space over the $R of $dim n"
    parameters raw"\theta" "vector of parameters" (domain=Rn,)
    normal raw"\mathrm{Normal}(#1,#2^2)" raw"normal distribution with mean $#1$ and standard deviation $#2$" (display_args=(mu, sigma), )
]  

write_texdefs("_symbols.tex", objects)
Markdown.parse("""\```
$(DynamicLatex.texdefs(objects))
\```""")
```
{{< include _symbols.tex >}}

```{julia}
write_symbols_table("_symbols.md", objects);
Markdown.parse("""\```
$(DynamicLatex.symbols_table(objects))
\```""")  
```
{{< include _symbols.md >}}

# Quarto extension

At some point in the HTML rendering process, latex commands which are not in a math environment
will be stripped out, such that one gets the below output.

Input|Intended output|Output without quarto extension
-|-|-
`Consider $\Rn$, a \dRn.`|Consider $\Rn$, a \dRn.|Consider $\Rn$, a .
